page.title: 02Christchurch Mansion Ipswich
page.content: Christchurch Mansion is in Christchurch park which is situated near Ipswich town centre. The mansion was built on the site of the Augustinian Priory of the Holy Trinity for Edmund Withipoll in 1548.After passing through many generations Felix Thornley Cobbold handed the historic building over to the Ipswich Corporation.Ipswich then turned it into a museum.So it is due to Felix's generosity that we can look round the mansion.The mansion has about 30 rooms each of which is set out to show various periods of history.The staircase and the hall are decorated with paintings.There is also an art gallery containing many famous paintings including some by John Constable.At one time Christchurch park was the garden of the mansion but it was handed over with the mansion.
